sub_title: Employer Relations Manager / CEMS Corporate Relations at Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
summary:
In my role as Employer Relations Manager, I constantly create new and expand existing relationships with small and medium sized businesses, NGOs as well as large national and international organisations. I collaborate strategically with employers to help them raise their profile and build their brand on campus leading to exclusive opportunities for RSM students. 

Driven by a special interest in the drives and motivations of others, I have a preference for continuously enlarging my network in order to build and maintain partnerships. My networking skills combined with my project management skills enable me to constantly improve business goals and results.

company.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

profile_positions.company: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
profile_positions.description:
• Creating new and expanding existing relationships with organisations in the private and public sector aimed at improving the employability of RSM students.
• Collaborating closely with employers to implement bespoke employer engagement initiatives and to generate exclusive Consultancy projects.
• Overseeing the planning and execution of major recruitment events like RSM’s Career Bootcamp, the International Career Event and the Graduate Jobs Festival.
• Taking charge of event creation, including large scale recruitment fairs, employer-led skills sessions, company presentations and online virtual assessments.
• Generating revenue through sponsorships, workshops, skills sessions, large scale fairs, and social media engagement.
• Establishing and strengthening partnerships with CEMS Corporate and Social Partners to provide opportunities for their involvement with CEMS students within the academic curriculum and at extracurricular activities.
• Collaborating strategically with CEMS School members to ensure and develop cohesive, collaborative approaches to corporate relationships.
profile_positions.title: Employer Relations Manager / CEMS Corporate Relations Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Building and maintaining relationships with small and medium sized London businesses as well as large national and international organisations aimed at creating engagement opportunities with City students.
•	Working closely together with employers to implement bespoke employer engagement activity and to generate exclusive Micro-Placements projects and Industry Insight sessions, all based on data findings (application data, Graduate Outcomes data, Careers Registration data, and student demographics).
•	Project managing the university’s inaugural business to business event, aimed at creating effective partnerships with medium sized and large international organisations, called ‘Business Breakfast: Diversity & Social Mobility’ for 80 employer representatives. 
•	Project managing City Careers’ careers fairs (e.g. City Law Fair and Final Year’s Jobs Fair), employer-led skills sessions, panel events and round-table sessions for City students and graduates.
•	Project lead for the organisation of The Careers Group - Global Careers Series; a cross-college collaboration with UCL, King’s, SOAS, and Goldsmith’s aimed at efficiently organising five successful international focused careers events for 250 students. 
•	Generating income through sponsorships, workshops, targeted mail-shots, fair stands, and on campus stalls.
•	Supervising five student City Career Ambassadors (CCAs); organising and leading regular CCA team meetings, monitoring weekly performance, and arranging one-to-ones to discuss individual performance.
•	Sharing City Careers’ successes by delivering presentations externally. Examples include: 1) EURASHE conference for professional and academic staff of various European universities, and 2) the delivery of a webinar in close collaboration with QMUL Careers Service for colleagues within The Careers Group.
profile_positions.title: Employer Engagement Adviser

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed university-wide strategic Employability project:
        - Project managed the implementation of Leiden University’s online careers portal;
        - Developed and implemented a marketing strategy to increase the visibility of the Careers Services among students and staff.
•	Provided one-to-one careers advice and delivered workshops to (international) students and graduates on careers orientation and job application techniques, e.g. how to write the perfect CV and cover letter, interview techniques, and assessments – utilising my ING/KLM recruitment experience.
•	Project managed careers events, e.g. ‘International careers event’, ‘Working as trainee’, and ‘Working as a researcher’.
•	Developed and implemented an online and offline communication strategy for the Student Support Services department (35 staff members).
profile_positions.title: Careers Consultant / Project Employability

profile_positions.description:
•	Implemented effective sourcing strategies  to recruit high-potential candidates for the ING International Talent Programme – Finance track; hired 7 graduates out of 400 candidates (target: 5 graduates).
•	Guided candidates through the recruitment procedure and provided them with personal updates and briefings to prepare them for each stage of the selection procedure.
•	Built and managed effective partnerships with university partners and relevant student associations aimed at driving pipeline growth and maximising university engagement. 
•	Project-managed insights events with the goal of recruiting candidates for all traineeship tracks and improving the employer branding position of ING bank.
•	Responsible for internal stakeholder management with senior management within the accountancy division.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Recruiter

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for managing the full-cycle recruitment process for higher-education-level internships and graduation projects (bachelor’s/master’s).
•	Drafted and posted vacancies, scheduled and conducted interviews with (senior) hiring managers, provided candidates with personal feedback, and evaluated sourcing strategies.
•	Built and managed relationships with university partners to constantly drive lead management. 
•	Delivered presentations at external recruitment events aimed at promoting the employer brand of KLM.
•	Implemented a digital internship database aimed at optimising the recruitment process and creating an annual forecast system.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Recruiter

profile_positions.description:
•	Researched and wrote a report on team development
•	Developed methods to help employees further develop their talents
•	Organised a knowledge exchange session for the whole HR department
•	Supported the HRD team in professionalising their advisory process
•	Recruited and pre-selected candidates for a new internship position
profile_positions.title: Intern Human Resources Development

profile_positions.description:
•	Text editing 
•	Translated texts from English to Dutch/Dutch to English
•	Archived digital files
•	Dealt with other common activities in support of staff
profile_positions.title: Administrative assistant departments Corporate Communications & Building Technologies

profile_positions.description:
•	Enrolled new candidates
•	Client acquisition aimed at bringing in new staffing clients
•	Selected candidates for temporary jobs
•	Drafted employment contracts
•	Called candidates to check their availability
•	Supported the agency recruiters in finishing their daily tasks
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Assistant

volunteer_experiences.role: Student and Academic Services | Social Committee
volunteer_experiences.description:
Student and Academic Services (S&AS) is comprised of diverse personalities, skill-sets, workloads and working patterns all contributing to activities that enable the student journey and embrace the values of City, University of London.

The Social Committee relishes in this diversity and is dedicated to running inclusive events in an interactive social environment with a view to celebrating the individuality of S&AS staff members. We aim to put on four activities a year outside of the work community that provide a platform for building, maintaining and sustaining personal relationships and that draw from the interests of the collective and showcase the multi-faceted nature of the Directorate.

- Organised career related and social events for young staff members of Leiden University (200 members), aiming at personal development, collaboration, and knowledge exchange.
- Examples of events: ‘Your next career step’, ‘Sharing your work successes’, ‘Pubquiz’ in close cooperation with Young Technical University Delft and Young Erasmus University.

Contact person and representative of the division Student and Educational Affairs:
Fostered the participation of members and recruiting new members within the division Student and Educational Affairs.

- Informed high school students about the bachelor program Psychology and studying in general at recruitment events
- Guided new students of the University during the annual introduction week
- Made high school students enthusiastic for the bachelor program Psychology by means of a short film

volunteer_experiences.role: Student member of the Daily Board of department Social and Organisational Psychology
volunteer_experiences.description:
In the role of student representative: 

gave my opinion about  and discussed the program and research of the Master section Social and Organisational Psychology with lecturers and researchers

- Led the study association of 3.000 members in close cooperation with 6 board members
- Established and maintained contacts with members and external contacts
- Developed, implemented and evaluated the policy for the study association
- Supervised a committee of 12 students; organising and leading regular team meetings and monitoring weekly performance
- Professionalised the member administration system
- Organised study related and social activities
- Recruited and selected candidates for the the new board

- Acquisition
- Organised events, e.g. study trip to the University of Brussels (Belgium) and Strasbourg (France)
- Sold study books
- Organised a visiting day for parents of all first-year psychology students
- Advised the board of the study association
